info.title: Voucherify API
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details.

post.description:
Creates a new project. You can add users, specify the cluster, timezone, currency, and other details.

All owners are added to the project by default.

200.description: Returns the details of a created project.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is missing required properties in the request.

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

403.description: Returns an error if the project is to be created in a cluster that is unavailable to the user.

value.details: Project is bound to different region

case_sensitive_codes.description: Determines if the vouchers in the project will be case sensitive (if `true`, `C0dE-cfV` is not equal to `c0de-cfv`) or case insensitive (if false, `C0dE-cfV` is equal to `c0de-cfv`).

messages.description: Determines the notification settings for distributed messages according to the day and month limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon.

api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

bulk_api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for bulk API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

webhook_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for webhook calls made for the daily limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum four times a day.

cycle_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the billing cycle limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per the billing cycle.

cluster_id.description: The identifier of the cluster where the project will be created. The default cluster is `eu1` unless otherwise configured.

api_version.description: The API version used in the project. Currently, the default and only value is `v2018-08-01`.

users.description:
The users (their identifiers, logins, and roles) who will be assigned to the project. You can assign only existing Voucherify users.

It must be used either in the following combinations:
- `id` and `role`, or
- `login` and `role`.

items.title: Create Project Users
items.description:
Contains details about the users who will be assigned to the project.
Only the `id` and `role` or `login` and `role` should be provided in the request.

id.description:
The unique identifier of the user who will be assigned to the project. It can be found in Team Settings > Team > Edit member. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `login` string.

login.description:
The login data of the user who will be assigned to the project. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `id` string.

role.description:
The role of the user to be added. It can be one of the following predefined roles:
`ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`
or an ID of a custom role.

ManagementProjectsAPIKeys.title: Project and Side Keys
ManagementProjectsAPIKeys.description: Returns `app_id` and `app_token` for the server-side and client-side authentication.

server_side_key.title: Server-side key
server_side_key.description: Contains the `app_id` and `app_token` to authenticate server-side requests.

app_id.title: Application ID
app_id.description: Application ID to be used as `X-App-Id` header in every HTTP request.

app_token.title: Application token
app_token.description:
Application token to be used as `X-App-Token` header in every HTTP request.

The application token (secret key) for the server-side authentication is visible in the Project Settings for 14 days when it is first generated in a newly-created project. Write your application token down and keep it in a safe place.

client_side_key.title: Client-side key
client_side_key.description: Contains the `app_id` and `app_token` to authenticate client-side requests.

app_id.title: Application ID
app_id.description: Application ID to be used as `X-App-Id` header in every HTTP request.

app_token.title: Application token
app_token.description:
Application token to be used as `X-App-Token` header in every HTTP request.

The application token (secret key) for the client-side authentication is visible in the Project Settings for 14 days when it is first generated in a newly-created project. Write your application token down and keep it in a safe place.
